intro: Cornera, commonly known as the common corner plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. It is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in pairs along the stems. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Cornera is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to several meters in height, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticulture.
